pageProps.contentHtml:
density argument, Lp spaces

Let

Kt(x)=(4πt)−3/2e−∣x∣2/4t,x∈R3, t>0,K_t\p{x} = \p{4\pi t}^{-3/2} e^{-\abs{x}^2/4t}, \quad x \in \R^3,\ t > 0,Kt​(x)=(4πt)−3/2e−∣x∣2/4t,x∈R3, t>0,

where ∣x∣\abs{x}∣x∣ is the Euclidean norm of x∈R3x \in \R^3x∈R3.

  1. Show that the linear map

    L3(R3)∋f↦t1/2Kt∗f∈L∞(R3)L^3\p{\R^3} \ni f \mapsto t^{1/2} K_t * f \in L^\infty\p{\R^3}L3(R3)∋f↦t1/2Kt​∗f∈L∞(R3)

    is bounded, uniformly in t>0t > 0t>0. Here

    (Kt∗f)(x)=∫R3Kt(x−y)f(y) dy\p{K_t * f}\p{x} = \int_{\R^3} K_t\p{x - y}f\p{y} \,\diff{y}(Kt​∗f)(x)=∫R3​Kt​(x−y)f(y)dy

    is the convolution.

  2. Prove that t1/2∥Kt∗f∥L∞→0t^{1/2} \norm{K_t * f}_{L^\infty} \to 0t1/2∥Kt​∗f∥L∞​→0 as t→0t \to 0t→0, for f∈L3(R3)f \in L^3\p{\R^3}f∈L3(R3).
Solution.

  1. First, observe that 13+13/2=1\frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{3/2} = 131​+3/21​=1. Then by Hölder's inequality,

    ∣t1/2(Kt∗f)(x)∣≤t1/2∫R3∣Kt(x−y)∣∣f(y)∣ dy≤t1/2∥Kt∥L3/2∥f∥L3.\begin{aligned} \abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * f}\p{x}} &\leq t^{1/2} \int_{\R^3} \abs{K_t\p{x-y}}\abs{f\p{y}} \,\diff{y} \\ &\leq t^{1/2} \norm{K_t}_{L^{3/2}} \norm{f}_{L^3}. \end{aligned}∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗f)(x)∣∣​​≤t1/2∫R3​∣Kt​(x−y)∣∣f(y)∣dy≤t1/2∥Kt​∥L3/2​∥f∥L3​.​

    Next, we have

    ∥Kt∥L3/23/2=∫R3(4πt)−9/4e−3∣x∣2/2t dx=∫R3(4πt)−9/4e−3∣x∣2/2 dx(x↦xt1/2)=t3/2(4πt)9/4∫R3e−3∣x∣2/2 dx≕C3/2t−3/4  ⟹  ∥Kt∥L3/2=Ct−1/2.\begin{aligned} \norm{K_t}_{L^{3/2}}^{3/2} &= \int_{\R^3} \p{4\pi t}^{-9/4} e^{-3\abs{x}^2/2t} \,\diff{x} \\ &= \int_{\R^3} \p{4\pi t}^{-9/4} e^{-3\abs{x}^2/2} \,\diff{x} && \p{x \mapsto \frac{x}{t^{1/2}}} \\ &= \frac{t^{3/2}}{\p{4\pi t}^{9/4}} \int_{\R^3} e^{-3\abs{x}^2/2} \,\diff{x} \\ &\eqqcolon C^{3/2}t^{-{3/4}} \\ \implies \norm{K_t}_{L^{3/2}} &= Ct^{-1/2}. \end{aligned}∥Kt​∥L3/23/2​⟹∥Kt​∥L3/2​​=∫R3​(4πt)−9/4e−3∣x∣2/2tdx=∫R3​(4πt)−9/4e−3∣x∣2/2dx=(4πt)9/4t3/2​∫R3​e−3∣x∣2/2dx=:C3/2t−3/4=Ct−1/2.​(x↦t1/2x​)

    Putting these together,

    ∣t1/2(Kt∗f)(x)∣≤C∥f∥L3,\abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * f}\p{x}} \leq C\norm{f}_{L^3},∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗f)(x)∣∣​≤C∥f∥L3​,

    so the map is bounded.

  2. Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. By density, there exists g∈Cc(R3)g \in C_c\p{\R^3}g∈Cc​(R3) such that ∥f−g∥L3<ε\norm{f - g}_{L^3} < \epsilon∥f−g∥L3​<ε. Thus, by the triangle inequality and the estimate above,

    ∣t1/2(Kt∗f)(x)∣≤∣t1/2(Kt∗(f−g))(x)∣+∣t1/2(Kt∗g)(x)∣≤C∥f−g∥L3+C∣t1/2(Kt∗g)(x)∣≤Cε+C∣t1/2(Kt∗g)(x)∣\begin{aligned} \abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * f}\p{x}} &\leq \abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * \p{f - g}}\p{x}} + \abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * g}\p{x}} \\ &\leq C\norm{f - g}_{L^3} + C\abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * g}\p{x}} \\ &\leq C\epsilon + C\abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * g}\p{x}} \end{aligned}∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗f)(x)∣∣​​≤∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗(f−g))(x)∣∣​+∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗g)(x)∣∣​≤C∥f−g∥L3​+C∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗g)(x)∣∣​≤Cε+C∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗g)(x)∣∣​​

    Since ggg is compactly supported, it is bounded by some M>0M > 0M>0 and so

    ∣∫R3Kt(x−y)g(y) dy∣≤(4πt)−3/2∫R3e−∣x−y∣2/4t∣g(y)∣ dy=(4πt)−3/2∫R3e−∣x−y∣2/4t∣g(y)∣ dy(y↦x−yt)=(4πt)−3/2t3/2∫R3e−∣y∣2/4∣g(x−yt)∣ dy≤(4π)−3/2M∫R3e−∣y∣2/4 dy≕A.\begin{aligned} \abs{\int_{\R^3} K_t\p{x - y} g\p{y} \,\diff{y}} &\leq \p{4\pi t}^{-3/2} \int_{\R^3} e^{-\abs{x-y}^2/4t} \abs{g\p{y}} \,\diff{y} \\ &= \p{4\pi t}^{-3/2} \int_{\R^3} e^{-\abs{x-y}^2/4t} \abs{g\p{y}} \,\diff{y} && \p{y \mapsto \frac{x - y}{\sqrt{t}}} \\ &= \p{4\pi t}^{-3/2} t^{3/2} \int_{\R^3} e^{-\abs{y}^2/4} \abs{g\p{x - y\sqrt{t}}} \,\diff{y} \\ &\leq \p{4\pi}^{-3/2} M \int_{\R^3} e^{-\abs{y}^2/4} \,\diff{y} \\ &\eqqcolon A. \end{aligned}∣∣​∫R3​Kt​(x−y)g(y)dy∣∣​​≤(4πt)−3/2∫R3​e−∣x−y∣2/4t∣g(y)∣dy=(4πt)−3/2∫R3​e−∣x−y∣2/4t∣g(y)∣dy=(4πt)−3/2t3/2∫R3​e−∣y∣2/4∣∣​g(x−yt​)∣∣​dy≤(4π)−3/2M∫R3​e−∣y∣2/4dy=:A.​(y↦t​x−y​)

    Thus,

    ∣t1/2(Kt∗f)(x)∣≤Cε+CAt1/2  ⟹  lim sup⁡t→0 ∣t1/2(Kt∗f)(x)∣≤Cε,\abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * f}\p{x}} \leq C\epsilon + CAt^{1/2} \implies \limsup_{t\to0}\,\abs{t^{1/2} \p{K_t * f}\p{x}} \leq C\epsilon,∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗f)(x)∣∣​≤Cε+CAt1/2⟹t→0limsup​∣∣​t1/2(Kt​∗f)(x)∣∣​≤Cε,

    which was what we wanted to show.
